title: RN (IMG for House Calls)-Driver Provided

- Coordinate and provide home community care for patients requiring ongoing medical support.

- Valid RN license and BLS certification.

- Proficiency in venipuncture techniques and diagnostic evaluation procedures.  
- Familiarity with senior care and hospice palliative medicine practices.  
- Strong communication skills and the ability to work effectively in a team environment.

title: Door to Door Alarm Sales Representative
description:
First Guardian Security Services, one of the fastest growing security companies in the U.S.A. is seeking Outside Sales Representatives with an entrepreneurial spirit and a burning desire to succeed to join our team to sell alarm security systems to homeowners and businesses. This is a sales position with unlimited earning potential (Our best sales representatives make $15,000 a month or more in commissions)! You can sell home automation devices like remote door locks, smart thermostats, and automated lighting controls which are making our traditional security business explode! You can create your own revenue stream building a referral program including Realtors, Home Builders and Home Inspectors. With state-of-the-art security systems which includes Cellular Communication, Remote Access, Voice Control, Geo-Fencing Services, Live View and Live Answer, Bluetooth Disarming, Two-Way Voice Cameras with motion detection activated recording and 24/7 continuous recording, Video Analytics, and Parameter Guard and with Vector Security the most trusted name and the pioneer in the alarm industry you will have the competitive advantage over the competition and sell alarm systems with ease!

YOU WILL RECEIVE:

**\\* TOP COMMISSIONS** - Very high commission structure with no cap on earnings!

**\\* SAME DAY PAYOUT** - Get paid the same day after installation on your deals via Direct Deposit, Cash App, Venmo or Zelle!

**\\* UP-SELL ADDITIONAL EQUIPMENT** - You can up-sell additional equipment to make more money!

**\\* SAME DAY AND NEXT DAY INSTALLATIONS** - Get you deals installed the same day or next day from when you close them!

**\\* FREE LEADS** from www.optileads.net, the most up-to-date and complete leads in the industry and the only company of Its kind to offer this using their patent pending software. These leads are of recently sold homes that need a security system from zip codes that you choose and are route optimized for the Traveling Salesman. No other dealer offers this!

**\\* FREE PERSONALIZED MARKETING MATERIALS** – Get free marketing materials (business cards, flyers, and door hangers) with your name and phone number on it!

**\\* TEAM BUILDING** - Build your own team and make money as a manager.

**\\* EASY ONBOARDING** - No startup costs, no waiting time and no meetings!

**\\* BE YOUR OWN BOSS** - No required events, no morning meetings, no assigned territories, no assigned schedule; Sell whenever you want and anywhere you want!

**\\* 24/7 ADMIN SUPPORT** - We provide 24/7 support by phone or WhatsApp Messenger Group and make it EASY to process deals so you can focus on production.

You can easily make a GREAT six-figure income with the help of the First Guardian Security Services Team, Optileads and the leader in the industry – Vector Security. Change your future with us and we will help you make it to the TOP!

First Guardian Security Services is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Learn more and apply to join us at www.myfirstguardian.com/apl today!

title: Finance Officer
description:
Job Summary:

Memor NYC (Memor Museum), a company specializing in the promotion and exhibition of Asian art and cultures, is seeking a skilled **Finance Officer** to join the team. In this role, you will assist the Accounting department in bookkeeping and proceeding transactions in addition to helping manage company financial reports and staff salary/reimbursement distribution. This position is on-site at our New York City office. This position requires full professional working proficiency in Mandarin.**Finance Officer Responsibilities:**

* Assist Accountant in maintaining bookkeeping, processing invoices, preparing balance sheets, inputting financial data, conducting financial reports and managing annual budget
* Process payroll transactions, vendor payments and reimbursements
* Update finance policies and procedures if needed
* Support staff in answering questions about finance, budget and personal reimbursement, benefits, etc.
* Deliver results in a timely manner and respond to upper management with sense of urgency and appropriate follow-through

**Required Qualifications & Skills**

* Minimum BS/BA and 2 years overall experience in finance/accounting staff support role
* Basic knowledge of NYC legal financial/accounting policies, particularly those pertaining to a small business or start-up
* Excellent communication, organization and attention to detail
* Work experiences or knowledge in start-up companies, preferred
* Must be proficient in Mandarin

**About the Company**

Memor NYC is a Manhattan-based company dedicated to sharing and presenting Asian cultures to the general public through special exhibitions, interactive cultural relic IPs and community-oriented events. Pioneering local and international museum experiences at the intersection of art, culture and technology, Memor NYC is currently preparing to establish Memor Museum on the Upper East Side.

title: RN, Oncology/Hematology-Infusion
description:
Overview

*At Essen Health Care, we care for that!* 

*As the largest privately held multispecialty medical group in the Bronx, we provide high-quality, compassionate, and accessible medical care to some of the most vulnerable and under-served residents of New York State. Guided by a Population Health model of care, Essen has five integrated clinical divisions offering urgent care, primary care, and specialty services, as well as nursing home staffing and care management. Founded in 1999, our over 20-year commitment has fueled an unwavering dedication toward innovating a better healthcare delivery system. Essen has expanded from a single primary care office to an umbrella organization offering specialties from women’s health to endocrinology, from psychiatry to a vast array of other specialties. All clinical services are offered via telehealth or in-person at over 35 medical offices and at home through the Essen House Calls program.* 

*Essen Health Care is the place Where Care Comes Together! We are looking for the most talented and effective individuals to join our rapidly growing company. With over 1,100 employees and 400+ Practitioners, we care for over 250,000 patients annually in New York City and beyond. From medical providers to administration & operational staff, there is a career here for you. Join our team today!*

Job Summary

Job Summary: Oncology RN’s main duty is to supervise and provide nursing care to our cancer patients. They monitor patient’s condition, develop care plans, develop symptom management protocols, and administer medication.

The responsibilities of our oncology nurses goes beyond direct patient care, with roles as research, manager, consultant, and patient educator. He/she will work hand-in-hand with physicians and other healthcare team members to ensure the greatest quality of care for the patient.

Responsibilities

* Create individualized care plans on patient under their supervision and care.
* Recognize and treat cancer-related issues.
* Collaborate with a team of healthcare professionals to share expertise and knowledge.
* Do cancer research to enhance treatment protocols assigned to cancer patients.
* Give supportive resources on the patient and the families to promote positive outlook.
* Teach patients and the families regarding treatment expectations.
* Watch and record the patient’s progress on a constant basis.
* Chart the patient’s response to treatment and medication.
* Performs other related duties as assigned.

Qualifications

* Licensed to practice as a Registered Professional Nurse in New York State
* Education: Bachelors Degree in Nursing
* Prior experience in Oncology is preferred
* Willing to train! 1 year experience as an RN
* Fulltime 9-5 Mon-Fri
* Current BLS/CPR and ACLS certification
* Must IV-Infusion experience/ willing to get certified
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills for professional role

Equal Opportunity Employer

***Essen Health care is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we seek candidates who desire to work in and serve an ethnically diverse population.***

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Travel nursing, Permanent

Pay: $80,000.00 - $100,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Medical Specialty:

* Cardiology
* Dermatology
* Emergency Medicine
* Geriatrics
* Internal Medicine
* Oncology
* Primary Care
* Urgent Care
* Urology

Work Location: In person

title: Experienced Pet Groomer
description:
**Benefits:**  

* Company car
* Bonus based on performance
* Competitive salary
* Flexible schedule
* Free uniforms
* Opportunity for advancement
* Paid time off

  

**Benefits/Perks**  

* Participation in building a new business
* Paid Training
* PTO
* Commission & Tips
* Competitive Compensation
* We provide a Mercedes-Benz Sprinter Van fully equipped with air conditioning, a hydrobath, and a grooming salon
* Fuel Cost Covered
* Appointment Schedule Managed by Office
* Supplies/Tools Provided
* Sharpening and maintenance offered for self-owned tools
* More benefits to come as we grow!

  

  

**Company Overview**  

Founded in Australia in 1996, Aussie Pet Mobile established its global headquarters in the United States in 1999 and has grown to become the number one franchised brand in mobile pet grooming worldwide.  

Our mobile pet grooming van is custom-designed with air conditioning, heat, electricity, and water, and relies on no outside electrical or water hookups. We are environmentally friendly! The van’s spacious interior helps pets maneuver easily and enhances the groomer’s ability to ensure all of the pet’s needs are met. Aussie Pet Mobile is 100% cage-free, one-on-one attention in the comfort of our client’s driveway.  

  

**Job Summary**  

Perfect Career For Animal Lovers!  

Make a real difference in the lives of pets and their families.  

Potential candidates must love pets, have a clean driving record, and be able to work independently without direct supervision. Must be able to communicate with pet family members about what is best for their pet.  

Need to have previous grooming experience as well as pet handling skills for a wide range of pets and personalities. If you really love animals this is the perfect career path for you. Our groomers develop a close and special relationship with every pet they care for and with their families as well. Generous commissions and excellent tips provide an outstanding income opportunity and the chance to turn your love of pets into a career that can support you for a lifetime. Earn anywhere from $1,100 to $2,000 per week.  

  

  

**Responsibilities**  

* Very reliable
* Loves animals
* Excellent customer service skills
* Relationship building skills
* Excellent listening skills
* Team player
* Clean driving record

  

  

**Qualifications**  

* High school or equivalent (Preferred)
* Experience with grooming pets
* Valid driver’s license and clean driving record
* Experience with cats (Preferred)

  

**The positions on this website, unless otherwise indicated, are posted by Aussie Met Mobile® franchisees. Aussie Pet Mobile® franchises are independently owned and operated businesses and if you accept a position with a Aussie Pet Mobile® franchisee, you are employed by that franchisee, and not by franchisor HFC Aussie Pet Mobile, nor any of its parents or affiliates. The hiring franchisee is solely responsible for all employment decisions including hiring, termination, discipline, compensation and benefits and HFC Aussie Pet Mobile LLC and its parents and affiliates have no input or involvement in such matters. HFC Aussie Pet Mobile LLC does not receive, review or store any applications for employment. Any questions about posted positions or the hiring process must be directed to the Aussie Pet Mobile® franchisee posting the position.**

  


***If you do not see a position available at your local Aussie Pet Mobile, you can contact our local business owners directly. See our list of locations here: https://aussiepetmobile.com/aussie-pet-mobile-locations/***

title: Operations Manager
description:
Job Summary:

Memor NYC (Memor Museum), a company specializing in the promotion and exhibition of Asian art and cultures, is seeking a skilled **Operations Manager** to join the team. In this role, you will lead on-site company operations and ensure smooth daily performance through integration of organization policies, inventory budgeting management, and prioritization of efficiency and quality control in projects and day-to-day operations. You will collaborate closely with management and other staff members to develop high-level organization and staff training guidelines, lead smooth implementation of museum event initiatives, support start-up company development and ensure alignment with budgetary and resource goals and values. This position is on-site at our New York City office. This position requires full professional working proficiency in Mandarin.

**Operations Manager Responsibilities:**

**Lead on-site company operations to ensure smooth daily functioning through development and integration of organizational, staff training, and budgetary guidelines in alignment with company goals and resource initiatives**

* Ensure customer service satisfaction according to corporate professional standards and coordinate with Sales team to implement policies for sustained satisfaction and improvement
* General operational knowledge and management experience in human resources, finance and legal affairs
* Work with sales team to manage inventory and sales records

**Collaborate with Project Manager to serve as a key communicator and liaison between our international team based in Beijing and our New York staff about event inventory, shipping details, and related on-site logistic matters that deal with event design planning and materials**

**Oversee related staff members in allocating tasks and ensuring deadline adherence**

**Conduct internal assessments of project organizational and resource development needs; put forth solution-oriented proposals to ensure smooth project delivery and store functionality**

**Deliver results in a timely manner and respond to upper management with sense of urgency and appropriate follow-through**

**Required Qualifications & Skills**

**Minimum of a BS/BA and minimum 3-5 years overall experience in an Operations Management role**

**Excellent communication, leadership and interpersonal skills to reach short and long-term goals in project success and annual company growth**

**Experience in leading a diverse and international team with broad and detailed perspectives on project scope and logistic implementation**

**General understanding or experience in sales setting or event planning industry, preferred**

**Work experiences or knowledge in the museum, entertainment or event planning industry, preferred**

**Work experiences or knowledge in start-up companies, preferred**

**Must be proficient in Mandarin**

cultures to the general public through special exhibitions, interactive cultural relic IPs and

description:

Flex schedules

description:
**Benefits:**  

* 401(k)
* Competitive salary
* Training & development
* Opportunity for advancement
* Wellness resources

  

SMART Behavioral Health Services, LLC is looking for an experienced Registered Behavior Technician or ABA Therapist in Weston, CT. The position is part time, 15-20 hours per week. Hours are in the afternoon, evening, and weekend.  

  

The ideal candidate will have experience implementing Behavior Support Plans, carrying out skill acquisition programs designed by the BCBA, record data throughout sessions, assist with family training to ensure generalization and fidelity of procedures. Applicant needs to be energetic and enthusiastic, able to keep a client engaged for the duration of the session,  

  

Applicant must be detail oriented, eager to work and learn, familiar collecting accurate data necessary for progress monitoring.  

  

Supervision towards BCBA certification hours is available.  

  

Opportunities for performance based bonuses and employee referral bonuses.  

  

After applying, applicants should be prepared to email cover letter, updated resume, and three relevant professional references.  

  

Necessary Experience: At least 1 years of relevant experience of providing direct ABA therapy.  

  

Job Type: Part-time  

  

Pay: $20.00 - $28.00 per hour  

  

SMART Behavioral Health Services, LLC is an independently owned ABA practice in Fairfield County, CT. Unlike many of the larger practices in the area, employees and clients are supervised by BCBAs that are highly qualified with flexible schedules. RBTs are guaranteed in-person contact with their supervising BCBA at least once per week, and are offered a wide range of professional development opportunities (including supervision towards BCBA credentialing).

title: General Manager(03526) - 3217 Junction Blvd
description:
**Company Description** **Store Management**  

  

Our Domino's Pizza General Managers are the backbone of our business! General Managers handle all aspects of running a Domino's Pizza store, including leading their team, setting high standards for customer service and maintaining exceptional product quality standards.  

  

  

**Opportunities!**  

  

Our Management Development Program allows only our own store managers to apply for franchising opportunities - which sets us apart from our competition. For many of our General Managers, the ultimate goal is to own their own business. Only individuals who have successfully managed a Domino's Pizza store for at least a year, are eligible to apply for a franchise. Join our team and learn how business ownership may be within your grasp! If you are looking for a career path within our corporation, you could become a Trainer or a Regional Manager in our field marketplace.  

  

  

**Great Pay!**  

  

Our managers are paid a starting base hourly wage of $19.50. In addition, managers are eligible to earn bonuses and incentives based on the profitability of their stores, as well as the store's overall performance.  

  

  

Qualified management applicants must be at least 18 years old, Some management experience is a plus. The ability to work in a fast-paced, high volume environment and be able to handle multiple tasks at once is required.

 **Job Description** **PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**, including, but not limited to the following:

**Standing**


Most tasks are performed from a standing position. Walking surfaces include ceramic tile "bricks" with linoleum in some food process areas. Height of work surfaces is between 36" and 48".

**Walking**


For short distances for short durations


Delivery personnel must travel between the store and delivery vehicle and from the delivery vehicle to the customer's location.

**Sitting**


Paperwork is normally completed in an office at a desk or table

**Lifting**


Bulk product deliveries are made twice a week or more and are unloaded by the team member using a hand truck.


Deliveries may include cases of ingredients and supplies weighing up to 50 pounds with dimensions of up to 3' x 1.5'.


Cases are usually lifted from floor and stacked onto shelves up to 72" high.

**Carrying**


Large cans, weighing 3 pounds, 7 ounces, are carried from the workstation to storage shelves.


Occasionally, pizza sauce weighing 30 pounds is carried from the storage room to the front of the store.


Trays of pizza dough are carried three at a time over short distances, and weigh approximately 12 pounds per tray.


During delivery, carry pizzas and beverages while performing "walking" and "climbing" duties.

 **Pushing**


To move trays which are placed on dollies.


A stack of trays on a dolly is approximately 24" - 30" and requires a force of up to 7.5 pounds to push.


Trays may also be pulled.

**Climbing**


Team members must infrequently navigate stairs or climb a ladder to change prices on signs, wash walls, perform maintenance.

**Stooping****/Bending**


Forward bending at the waist is necessary at the pizza assembly station.


Toe room is present, but workers are unable to flex their knees while standing at this station.


Duration of this position is approximately 30 - 45 seconds at one time, repeated continuously during the day.


Forward bending is also present at the front counter and when stocking ingredients.

**Crouching/Squatting**


Performed occasionally to stock shelves and to clean low areas.

**Reaching**


Reaching is performed continuously; up, down and forward.


Workers reach above 72" occasionally to turn on/off oven controls, change prices on sign, and lift and lower objects to and from shelves.


Workers reaching down to perform such tasks as scooping cornmeal from a plastic barrel, or washing dishes.


Workers reach forward when obtaining topping ingredients, cleaning work surfaces, or answering phones.

**Machines, Tools, Equipment, Work Aids**


Team Members may be required to utilize pencils/pens, computers, telephones, calculators, TDD equipment, pizza cutter and pizza peel.

 **Qualifications**  

* Valid U.S employment authorization that allows you to work in the United States of America.
* Friendly
* Works well with others.
* Works well under stress of high paced environment.
* Organized
* Efficient in time management.
* Must work weekends
* Preferred restaurant experience.
* Ability to multitask.
* Flexible but must understand you must work a minimum of 5 closing nights a week, including Friday, Saturday, and Sunday, non-negotiable
* Motivational skills
* Enthusiastic
* Possess the ability to train and develop a team.
* Able to make employee schedules
* Able to place stores food orders/maintain inventory.
* Able to keep the store employees in proper image.
* Able to respond to customer concerns.
* Must be able to follow Team Sharma Domino’s Policies.
* Must be able to work together as a team.
* Must understand all store calls must be answered after the first ring
* Exceptional product above all.

  

**Additional Information**  

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
company_description: Founded as a single store in 1960, DPZ is the largest pizza company in the world. From the beginning, Domino’s has been dedicated to the best of service, quality products, and delivery.

Our Customer Service Representatives (CSRs) are the first contact with our customers - so we value their commitment to exceptional customer service, enthusiastic attitude and the ability to assist our customers through the ordering process.  

  

**Get Paid to Talk!**  

  

In addition to providing exceptional customer service to our customers through order taking, our CSRs gain valuable experience through assisting with in-store duties and learning the pizza delivery business. Our CSR's will Earn an hourly base pay of $16.00!

title: Delivery Driver(03584) - 104 School St
description:
**Company Description** **Delivery Drivers**  

  

We recognize our delivery experts as the ambassadors of Domino's Pizza - from fresh out of the oven to the customer's door - our drivers make it happen.  

  

**Money!**  

  

Our delivery experts are paid cash daily from earned tips and mileage reimbursement. That is money in your pocket every night! Delivery Experts will earn a base hourly wage of $16.00!  

  

**Great Hours!**  

  

Looking for a second job? A part-time job? A chance to learn about the pizza business? A job with flexible hours? We deliver all of that! Whether you want to work only a few hours, just the weekend, or only evenings - we can usually make it work for you.  

  

**Opportunities!**  

Our driver position is an excellent start to learn about the delivery business, customer service and the creation of great products. Domino's Pizza is committed to promoting from within - most of our Managers started as drivers. It is a stepping stone to advancement into our Management Development Program.  

  

  

  

To drive for Domino's Pizza, you must be at least 18 years of age, have a valid driver's license and a good driving record. In addition, our qualified applicants must have an outstanding attitude toward customer service, have basic math skills, enjoy working in a fast-paced team surrounding and an insured vehicle that passes regular safety inspections.

 **Job Description**  

You must be 18 years of age and have a valid driver's license with a safe driving record meeting company standards as well as access to an insured vehicle which can be used for delivery. You should possess navigational skills to read a map, locate addresses within designated delivery area and must be able to navigate adverse terrain including multi-story buildings.

 **Qualifications**  

* Valid U.S employment authorization that allows you to work in the United States of America.
* Valid Drivers License, along with Valid Car registration / Insurance / Inspection in the applicants name
* Friendly
* Works well with others.
* Works well under stress of high paced environment.
* Organized
* Efficient in time management.
* Ability to multitask
* Able to respond to customer concerns.
* Must be able to follow Team Sharma Domino’s Policies.
* Must be able to work together as a team.
* Must understand all store calls must be answered after the first ring

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Front Desk Receptionist
description:
We are looking for a resourceful Front Desk Receptionist (Director of First Impressions) to join our passionate team at Keller Williams Legendary, Franklin Square, NY .

Growing your career as a Full Time Front Desk Receptionist is a fantastic opportunity to develop productive skills. If you are strong in people management, adaptability and have the right personality for the job, then apply for the position of Front Desk Receptionist at Keller Williams today!

Do you possess a strong work ethic and thrive in a high-energy, service-oriented environment? The ideal Front Desk Receptionist candidate is a bright and energetic team player who is detail-oriented, has a strong work ethic, and takes ownership of his or her work. You must be able to juggle multiple projects, work effectively in a fast-paced environment, and meet deadlines. You will be the first person to interact with potential clients and customers coming into the office. The Front Desk Receptionist is a crucial role that reflects upon the entire office. This is a great stepping stone opportunity to work towards a leadership role with an office or real estate team. This is a great opportunity to start a career with huge financial and growth opportunities. If this sounds like you, apply today!

* Answer phone properly with friendliness
* Greet everyone with a smile
* Assist management team
* Properly routing phone calls
* Greeting everyone in a positive manner
* Receive and sort mail and deliveries
* Maintain appearance of reception area
* Marketing and Social Media coordination - CANVA
* Calendar and Newsletter
* Daily Interactions with Sales Associates, MCA, and Team Leader

Qualifications:

* People skills and experience
* Computer skills
* Positive attitude
* Great verbal and communication skills
* Neat, clean, professional appearance
* Real estate license not required

About Company KELLER WILLIAMS Legendary is located in Franklin Square, NY.

Our office has approximately 280 agents and is looking to grow every day! We are a premier Real Estate Brokerage that specializes in training, coaching, and lead generation. KW was founded in 1983 by Gary Keller and Joe Williams with the mission to build careers worth having, businesses worth owning, and lives worth living for its associates. Keller Williams is an Austin, Texas-based real estate franchise company with over 180,000 associates worldwide; operating in approximately 930+ Market Centers across the globe. We are the #1 Real Estate Company in the United States by Agent Count, Units, and Volume. We also ranked #1 training company in real estate!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $18.00 per hour

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Preferred)

Ability to Relocate:

* Franklin Square, NY 11010: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person
company_description: Join the world's largest real estate company! Explore a career in real estate or an opportunity to transform the industry at corporate!

title: Pain Management Nurse Practitioner
description:
**Company Overview:** At Essen Health Care, we care for that!

As the largest privately held multispecialty medical group in the Bronx, we provide high-quality, compassionate, and accessible medical care to some of the most vulnerable and under-served residents of New York State. Guided by a Population Health model of care, Essen has five integrated clinical divisions offering urgent care, primary care, and specialty services, as well as nursing home staffing and care management. Founded in 1999, our over 20-year commitment has fueled an unwavering dedication toward innovating a better healthcare delivery system. Essen has expanded from a single primary care office to an umbrella organization offering specialties from women’s health to endocrinology, from psychiatry to a vast array of other specialties. All clinical services are offered via telehealth or in-person at over 35 medical offices and at home through the Essen House Calls program.

Essen Health Care is the place Where Care Comes Together! We are looking for the most talented and effective individuals to join our rapidly growing company. With over 1,100 employees and 400+ Practitioners, we care for over 250,000 patients annually in New York City and beyond. From medical providers to administration & operational staff, there is a career here for you. Join our team today!

Job Summary

**Position Title:** Pain Management Nurse Practitioner

**Job Summary:** Essen is looking for a Pain Management Nurse Practitioner who evaluates pain and treats a wide range of pain problems. The pain management NP provides patient care for people with chronic health issues or injuries that cause them pain. In this role, your duties include examining patients, reviewing their medical history, and consulting with other care providers before deciding on a therapy or treatment program to help them manage their pain.

Responsibilities

* Responsible for the care of patients with chronic or acute pain.
* Work closely with doctors and other nurses to create a treatment plan
* Administer medications and provide pain relief through other therapeutic methods/
* Teach patients and their families how to alleviate pain and make patients more comfortable.
* Serve as a liaison between the patient and the doctor to determine a medication’s effect and to make changes to improve the patient’s comfort level.
* Work closely with patients to manage their depression and anxiety beginning with initial diagnosis to med-initiation and follow-up care.
* Work hardening rehabilitation in an outpatient clinic setting
* Identify and screen patients for appropriate eligibility for protocol study participation

Qualifications

* A medical degree/ Valid NP license with NYS
* In-depth knowledge of pain disorders
* Ability to evaluate patients with difficult pain disorders
* Appropriate prescribing of medications for pain problems
* An ability to use different diagnostic tests to pinpoint the cause of pain
* Skill with procedures (nerve blocks, spinal injections, pain pumps)
* Treatment that is in line with a patient’s wishes and belief system

Salary: $130,000-$150,000

Equal Opportunity Employer

***Essen Health care is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we seek candidates who desire to work in and serve an ethnically diverse population.***

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $135,000.00 - $150,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Ability to Relocate:

* Bronx, NY: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Optometrist
description:
Overview

*At Essen Health Care, we care for that!* 

*As the largest privately held multispecialty medical group in the Bronx, we provide high-quality, compassionate, and accessible medical care to some of the most vulnerable and under-served residents of New York State. Guided by a Population Health model of care, Essen has five integrated clinical divisions offering urgent care, primary care, and specialty services, as well as nursing home staffing and care management. Founded in 1999, our over 20-year commitment has fueled an unwavering dedication toward innovating a better healthcare delivery system. Essen has expanded from a single primary care office to an umbrella organization offering specialties from women’s health to endocrinology, from psychiatry to a vast array of other specialties. All clinical services are offered via telehealth or in-person at over 35 medical offices and at home through the Essen House Calls program.* 

*Essen Health Care is the place Where Care Comes Together! We are looking for the most talented and effective individuals to join our rapidly growing company. With over 1,100 employees and 400+ Practitioners, we care for over 250,000 patients annually in New York City and beyond. From medical providers to administration & operational staff, there is a career here for you. Join our team today!*

Job Summary

**Job Summary:** Optometrists are focused on examining and correcting their patients’ vision, whether it’s nearsightedness, lack of depth perception, issues with color perception, or other matters. They also test for glaucoma and other eye issues.

Responsibilities

**Responsibilities include:**

* Conduct eye exams using optometric equipment and general diagnostic interpretation.
* Diagnose and treat ocular disease.
* Prescribe, fit, and adjust eyeglasses, contact lenses, and other vision aids.
* Recommend appropriate patient follow-up and care options.

title: Delivery Expert(03317) - 172 New Dorp Lane
description:
**Company Description** **Delivery Drivers**  

  

We recognize our delivery experts as the ambassadors of Domino's Pizza - from fresh out of the oven to the customer's door - our drivers make it happen.  

  

**Money!**  

  

Our delivery experts are paid cash daily from earned tips and mileage reimbursement. That is money in your pocket every night! Delivery Experts will earn a base hourly wage of $16.00!  

  

**Great Hours!**  

  

Looking for a second job? A part-time job? A chance to learn about the pizza business? A job with flexible hours? We deliver all of that! Whether you want to work only a few hours, just the weekend, or only evenings - we can usually make it work for you.  

  

**Opportunities!**  

Our driver position is an excellent start to learn about the delivery business, customer service and the creation of great products. Domino's Pizza is committed to promoting from within - most of our Managers started as drivers. It is a stepping stone to advancement into our Management Development Program.  

  

  

  

To drive for Domino's Pizza, you must be at least 18 years of age, have a valid driver's license and a good driving record. In addition, our qualified applicants must have an outstanding attitude toward customer service, have basic math skills, enjoy working in a fast-paced team surrounding and an insured vehicle that passes regular safety inspections.

 **Job Description**  

You must be 18 years of age and have a valid driver's license with a safe driving record meeting company standards as well as access to an insured vehicle which can be used for delivery. You should possess navigational skills to read a map, locate addresses within designated delivery area and must be able to navigate adverse terrain including multi-story buildings.

 **Qualifications**  

* Valid U.S employment authorization that allows you to work in the United States of America.
* Valid Drivers License, along with Valid Car registration / Insurance / Inspection in the applicants name
* Friendly
* Works well with others.
* Works well under stress of high paced environment.
* Organized
* Efficient in time management.
* Ability to multitask
* Able to respond to customer concerns.
* Must be able to follow Team Sharma Domino’s Policies.
* Must be able to work together as a team.
* Must understand all store calls must be answered after the first ring

  

**Additional Information**  

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Bartender
description:
Seeking experienced bartender for fun, casual neighborhood bar & restaurant in Prospect Lefferts Gardens.

**Duties will include:**

-working am/brunch shifts

-working pm/dinner shifts

-consistently executing all house cocktails with speed and efficiency

-creating a welcoming guest experience from greeting to goodbyes

-keeping guest areas tidy and clean, bussing tables and bar areas as needed

-prep work for bar service, and restocking bar products

-working with other team members to maintain bar pars & communicating purchasing or stock needs

-execution of given cocktail, bar infusion, and syrup recipes (with guidance given by manager, creator)

-regular cleaning of various FOH Bar areas like bar wells, fridges, shelves, liquor displays, ice machines

-washing your own glassware & tools/equipment, when it's not busy

-regular spot cleaning as you work (ie: sweeping, mopping, sanitizing, and keeping your workspace clean and organized)

-maintaining an accurate cash register and creating a blind cash drop at the end of a shift

-accurately reporting tips to tip pool

-key holding duties including closing/opening the space

**About us:**

Edie Jo's Restaurant in Prospect Lefferts Gardens is hiring and looking for experienced line cooks! Work with an easy going, yet dedicated and professional team in providing delicious options for our neighborhood. We're an owner-operated, local spot with an eye on hospitality, seasonality, and sustainability. The menu changes quarterly, and we work hard to support local farmers and vendors when we can. Menu is new american food with seasonal variations of classic cocktails. Think fresh muddled herbs in a swizzle, infused spritzes on draft, homemade shrubs, a rotating slushy menu, and lots of house made products. We are open Tuesday to Sunday for coffee, cocktails, and snacks, as well as morning brunch and evening dinner. (We are currently closed all day Monday, though this may change as we get busier.)

**Bar Hours:**

-Tuesday to Thursday 12pm-1am

-Friday 12pm-2am

-Saturday 10am-2am

-Sunday 10am-1am

**Desired Qualifications:**

-Experience working in classic cocktails, but happy to train the classics to someone who shows interest and dedication.

-Former bartending experience required; serving or bar backing experience may be considered with strong restaurant experience

-Hiring immediately

-Must be able to lift 50 lb

-Must be able to use arms to perform repetitive actions

-Must be able to stand on feet 8 hours+ and move quickly on one's feet

-Must be legally allowed to work in USA

-Must be 21 years or older

-Must be able to work Saturday & Sunday Brunch shifts

-Weekend availability is a must

Part-time hours: 16-24 per week

Expected Start Date: ASAP

All employees must follow all NYC/NYS required guidelines which include Department of Health hand washing & sanitation procedures. All employees must be 21+ and show proof of full vaccination against COVID-19.

Edie Jo's values a diverse workplace and strongly encourages women, people of color, LGBTQIA individuals, people with disabilities, members of ethnic minorities, foreign-born residents, and veterans to apply. We are an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will not be discriminated against because of race, color, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, religion, national origin, citizenship status, disability, ancestry, marital status, veteran status, medical condition or any protected category prohibited by local, state or federal laws.

title: Nurse Practitioner, Primary Care SPANISH SPEAKING
description:
**Overview**

*At Essen Health Care, we care for that!* 

*As the largest privately held multispecialty medical group in the Bronx, we provide high-quality, compassionate, and accessible medical care to some of the most vulnerable and under-served residents of New York State. Guided by a Population Health model of care, Essen has five integrated clinical divisions offering urgent care, primary care, and specialty services, as well as nursing home staffing and care management. Founded in 1999, our over 20-year commitment has fueled an unwavering dedication toward innovating a better healthcare delivery system. Essen has expanded from a single primary care office to an umbrella organization offering specialties from women’s health to endocrinology, from psychiatry to a vast array of other specialties. All clinical services are offered via telehealth or in-person at over 35 medical offices and at home through the Essen House Calls program.* 

*Essen Health Care is the place Where Care Comes Together! We are looking for the most talented and effective individuals to join our rapidly growing company. With over 1,100 employees and 400+ Practitioners, we care for over 250,000 patients annually in New York City and beyond. From medical providers to administration & operational staff, there is a career here for you. Join our team today!*

**Job Summary:** The Nurse Practitioner will be part of Essen growing medical professionals. Your primary responsibility will be to provide advanced primary and/or specialty care to our patients. Responsibilities will include but not limited to, performing physical exams, recording patient medical history, creating care plans and administering diagnostic test.

**Responsibilities**

* Examines, diagnoses and treats patients
* Ensures fulfillment of Essen Health Care commitment for ensuring quality care
* Diagnoses and treats variety of diseases in general practice
* Collects, records and maintains accurate patient information
* Documents items such as: past medical, family, and social history, review of systems, examinations, medications, allergies, assessment and plan
* Orders or executes various tests, analyses, and diagnostic images to provide information on patient's condition
* Analyzes reports and findings of tests and of examination, and diagnoses condition
* Administers or prescribes treatments
* Orders lab and imaging tests to determine and manage an immediate treatment plan
* Vaccinates patients to immunize patients from communicable diseases
* Advises patients concerning diet, hygiene, and methods for prevention of disease
* Consult with appropriate medical specialist when necessary; refer patient to subspecialists within network

**Qualifications**

* Master s Degree in a Nurse Practitioner Program: Family or Adult Geriatrics
* Current New York State License as a Nurse Practitioner.
* National Board Certification require
* American Association of Nurse Practitioners (AANP)
* American Nurses Credentialing Center (ANCC)
* Oncology Nursing Certification Corporation (ONCC)
* Bilingual (Spanish Speaking) is a plus
* EMR/EHR experience a plus
* New Grads are Encourage to Apply

Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Enrollment Specialist
description:
Everyone knows Aflac, but not everyone knows exactly what we do. That's where you come in!!!!

* Come work with the fastest growing Aflac team in country
* Work in a business-to-business marketing environment
* Set your own hours and schedule - true Work/Life Balance
* Flex your entrepreneurial skills
* Join our local Philanthropic Committee to help give back to our community that has given so much to us

\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*Please note you are applying for our local NY/CT/RI Teams\\*\\*\\*\\*

***Aflac isn’t a conventional opportunity*** We’re an unconventional company looking for unconventional people. If you’re outgoing, entrepreneurial and motivated, it might be time to unleash your potential as an Aflac benefits advisor. In return, you’ll gain the satisfaction of being in charge of your own success, from the hours you work to the income you earn.

***Be an advisor to business owners*** Aflac benefits advisors work directly with business owners and HR representatives to plan supplemental insurance coverage and other value-added services for employees. It’s a key role with growth potential for you, backed by the power, resources and trust of a well-known and reputable brand. And you’ll have the personal reward of helping to provide financial security and added peace of mind to clients when they experience a covered health event. Responsibilities include:

* Generating new business opportunities through company leads, networking, referrals and calls.
* Conducting meetings with employers to customize programs that help meet their benefits needs.
* Engaging and enrolling interested employees in benefits plans.
* Having ongoing conversations with business owners about new benefits options, benefits trends, changes to the government’s health care laws and more.

***Be your own boss and reap the benefits of your hard work*** With Aflac, you’re in charge. There are no ceilings to break through and no set hours. You decide how, when and where you work – whether from the local coffee shop, an outdoor café or the comfort of your home. It’s your trajectory on your terms. The personal satisfaction of knowing you are providing a service you can be proud of while making a positive impact in your community.

***Join the Aflac team*** When you join Aflac, you're joining a team of high-achieving individuals just like you. You’re also partnering with a company with a reputation for excellence:

* World’s Most Ethical Companies list – Ethisphere magazine included Aflac on its list for the 18th consecutive year in 2024
* World’s Most Admired Companies list – FORTUNE magazine named Aflac to the list for the 22tnd year in 2023
* Rated A+ for insurer financial strength by AM Best, Fitch and S&P.
* Aflac has donated more than $130 million toward pediatric cancer research.

title: Social Media Specialist
description:
Job Summary:

Memor NYC (Memor Museum), a company specializing in the promotion and exhibition of Asian art and cultures, is seeking a skilled **Social Media Specialist** to join the team. In this role, you will assist the Publicity and Marketing Manager in leading and running social media operations, marketing and advertising for company events, projects and daily promotion. You will oversee and present promotional plans for social media engagement and company accounts, including but not limited to Instagram/Meta, TikTok, WeChat, and Xiaohongshu. This position is on-site at our New York City office with occasional opportunity for remote work. This position requires full professional working proficiency in Mandarin.

**Social Media Specialist Responsibilities:**

•Assist Publicity and Marketing Manager in social media publicity and promotional efforts through meticulous and detailed planning to ensure strong company presence on major social media platforms popular in US and Asia/East Asia

* Run company social media accounts and engage proper advertising channels, media trends and influencer resources
* Develop and build relationships with KOLs for effective promotion

•Develop consistent branding and social media strategies and schedules, and work closely with our video team to plan and implement engaging content on a regular basis

•Create innovative social media content with a deep understanding of Asian international trends and New York local landscape to reach diverse groups interested in culture, entertainment and education

•Analyze social media coverage and trends to assess company media efficacy and present solutions to readjust to ensure ROI in timely manner

•Deliver results in a timely manner and respond to upper management with sense of urgency and appropriate follow-through

**Required Qualifications & Skills**

•Minimum of a BS/BA and minimum 2 years overall experience in a Social Media Management/Specialist role

* Must be well-versed in popular social media platforms, trends and audience tastes in Asia/East Asia as well as US/New York

•Excellent communication, organization and fluency in social media language/jargon in English and Chinese

•General understanding of or experience in marketing and Asian culture, required

* Experience in social media advertising, a plus

•Work experiences or knowledge in the museum, entertainment or event planning industry, preferred

•Work experiences or knowledge in start-up companies, preferred

•Must be proficient in Mandarin

About the Company

Memor NYC is a Manhattan-based company dedicated to sharing and presenting Asian

cultures to the general public through special exhibitions, interactive cultural relic IPs and

community-oriented events. Pioneering local and international museum experiences at

the intersection of art, culture and technology, Memor NYC is currently preparing to

establish Memor Museum on the Upper East Side.

description:
Overview

*At Essen Health Care, we care for that!* 

*As the largest privately held multispecialty medical group in the Bronx, we provide high-quality, compassionate, and accessible medical care to some of the most vulnerable and under-served residents of New York State. Guided by a Population Health model of care, Essen has five integrated clinical divisions offering urgent care, primary care, and specialty services, as well as nursing home staffing and care management. Founded in 1999, our over 20-year commitment has fueled an unwavering dedication toward innovating a better healthcare delivery system. Essen has expanded from a single primary care office to an umbrella organization offering specialties from women’s health to endocrinology, from psychiatry to a vast array of other specialties. All clinical services are offered via telehealth or in-person at over 35 medical offices and at home through the Essen House Calls program.* 

*Essen Health Care is the place Where Care Comes Together! We are looking for the most talented and effective individuals to join our rapidly growing company. With over 1,100 employees and 400+ Practitioners, we care for over 250,000 patients annually in New York City and beyond. From medical providers to administration & operational staff, there is a career here for you. Join our team today!*

Job Summary

**Job Summary:** We are seeking Audiologists who are experts in providing services in the prevention, diagnosis, and evidenced-based treatment of hearing and balance disorders for people of all ages. Hearing and balance disorders are complex with medical, psychological, physical, social, educational, and employment implications. Our Audiologists must provide professional and personalized services to minimize the negative impact of these disorders, leading to improved outcomes and quality of life.

Responsibilities

**Responsibilities include:**

* Examine patients who have hearing, balance, or related ear problems
* Assess the results of the examination and diagnose problems
* Determine and administer treatment to meet patients’ goals
* Provide treatment for tinnitus, a condition that causes ringing in the ear
* Fit and dispense hearing aids
* Counsel patients and their families on ways to listen and communicate, such as lip reading or through technology
* Evaluate patients regularly to check on hearing and balance and to continue or change treatment plans
* Record patient progress
* Research the causes and treatment of hearing and balance disorders
* Educate patients on ways to prevent hearing loss

Qualifications

**Job Requirements:**

* Medical Doctor (MD) or Doctor of Audiology
* Certificate of Clinical Competence in Audiology (CCC-A)
* Successful completion of an approved Audiology residency training program.
* Active License
* Current New York State Medical Practitioner License
* Experience with ECG, Echo, Stress Testing
* Bilingual (Spanish / English) is a plus but not a requirement

Equal Opportunity Employer

***Essen Health care is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we seek candidates who desire to work in and serve an ethnically diverse population.***

title: Nurse Practitioner (Nursing Home)
description:
Essen is currently seeking Full-time & Part-time Board-Certified Nurse Practitioners for our Nursing Home Division.

The Nurse Practitioner provides primary health care to long term care patients, which includes assessment and development of Plan of care in collaboration with the interdisciplinary team, provision of direct patient care and evaluation of effectiveness of plan of care. The Nurse Practitioner (NP) functions in a collegial and collaborative relationship with physicians and other health professionals making independent decisions about nursing needs and collaborative decisions with physicians regarding health regimens. Assumes dependent responsibilities in carrying out delegated medical acts. The quality of care is under the direction of the Senior Medical Director

The selected candidate will be responsible to perform daily Nurse Practitioner duties including but not limited to:

* Obtains a complete health history and records findings.
* Performs physical examinations, functional status evaluations, and/or mental status evaluations, orders and evaluates appropriate laboratory and diagnostic tests, and records findings.
* Identifies and describes behavioral patterns of the chronically ill associated with developmental processes, lifestyle, and family relationships
* Discriminates between normal and abnormal findings associated with aging, pathological processes, lifestyles and/or family relationships as influenced by chronic illness.
* Exercises clinical judgment in differentiating between situations.
* Confounded by acute chronic health status change, which the Nurse Practitioner can manage, and those, which require consultations and/or referrals.
* Interprets screenings and selected diagnostic tests
* Managing, Planning, Treating, Evaluating
* Provides preventative health care, episodic care and arranges referrals as needed
* Manages common self-limiting and or episodic health problems within scope of practice and according to current practice guidelines
* Manages stabilized chronic illnesses in collaboration with physicians according to current practice guidelines.
* Prescribes and adjusts medications within the scope of prescriptive authority and current practice guidelines
* Recommends symptomatic treatments and non-prescription medicines
* Assists clines and families to assure greater responsibility for their own health maintenance and illness care by providing instruction, counseling, and guidance
* Monitors patients in nursing home, to provide continuity of care and assists in discharge planning

The successful candidate will have the following Qualifications:

* Master s Degree in a Nurse Practitioner Program: Family, Adult, or Geriatric
* ANCC Certification
* Current New York State License as a Nurse Practitioner.
* National Board Certification required
* Advance Practice Nurse Prescriber License required
* DEA registration required
* Bilingual (Spanish Speaking) is a plus

title: Pharmacy Technician
description:
Job Description

Health is everything. At CVS Health, we are committed to increasing patient access to care, lowering costs and improving the quality of care. Millions of times a day, we’re helping people on their path to better health— from advising patients on their prescriptions to helping them manage their chronic and specialty conditions. Because we’re present in so many moments, big and small, we have an active, supportive role in shaping the future of health care. Pharmacy Technicians are at the forefront of our purpose as they deliver compassionate care to our millions of patients every day.

Come join our team of dedicated and caring Pharmacy Technicians who demonstrate our core values of Accountability, Caring, Collaboration,Innovation and Integrity in everything they do in our pharmacies every day. Whether you are new to working in pharmacies or are an experienced Pharmacy Technician, we have a place for you on our team to use your skills and talents to serve and care for our patients and customers.

The Pharmacy Technician position provides individuals with an opportunity to work in a leading retail pharmacy company and in a role that positively impacts the lives and health of others. You will work in an environment where the highest professional and ethical standards are maintained as well as full compliance with all Federal, State and Local laws and regulations. Pharmacy Technicians take important steps to ensure all medication needs and regulatory compliance standards are met for our patients and they demonstrate ethical conduct and maintain patient confidentiality at all times.

Success for incumbents in this role includes being able to manage all assigned pharmacy workstations and tasks to support the team’s ability to promptly, safely and accurately fill patient prescriptions all while providing caring service that exceeds customer expectations. If you like working in fast-paced environments and demonstrating compassionate, genuine care for patients and customers, this job is for you!

As a new Pharmacy Technician, you are required to complete an extensive CVS Pharmacy Technician Training Program as well as satisfy all registration, licensing and certification requirements according to your State’s Board of Pharmacy guidelines. Your Pharmacy Technician duties will be restricted by your manager at first until you complete all necessary requirements. Once you satisfy all requirements and expand your Pharmacy Technician duties, you have the opportunity to continue to build your clinical, technical and insurance knowledge and expertise by leveraging available tools and training to build your pharmacy career.

Are you ready to help people on their path to better health? We are ready to have you join our team and help you on your career path to achieve your goals!

Please note in select markets the collective bargaining agreement rules regarding the Pharmacy Technician would apply.

DISCLAIMER:

The above information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

Required Qualifications

* Must be at least 16 years of age
* Licensure requirements vary by state
* Attention and Focus

o The ability to concentrate on a task over a period of time without being distracted

* Customer Service Orientation

o Actively look for ways to help people, and do so in a friendly manner  
o Notice and understand customers’ reactions, and respond appropriately

* Communication Skills

o Use and understand verbal and written communication to interact with customers and colleagues  
o Actively listening by giving full attention to what others are saying, taking time to understand the points being made, asking questions as appropriate, and not interrupting at inappropriate times

* Mathematical Reasoning

o The ability to use math to solve a problem, such as calculating day’s supply of a prescription

* Problem Resolution

o Is able to judge when something is wrong or is likely to go wrong; recognizing there is a problem  
o Choosing the best course of action when faced with a complex situation with several available options

Physical Requirement:

* Remaining upright on the feet, particularly for sustained periods of time
* Moving about on foot to accomplish tasks, particularly for moving from one work area to another
* Picking, pinching, typing or otherwise working primarily with fingers rather than whole hand or arm
* Extending hand(s) and arm(s) in any direction
* Bending body downward and forward by bending spine at the waist
* Stooping to a considerable degree and requiring full use of the lower extremities and back muscles
* Expressing or exchanging ideas by means of spoken word; those activities where detailed or important spoken instructions must be conveyed accurately
* Perceiving the nature of sounds at normal speaking levels with or without correction, and having the ability to receive detailed information through oral communication
* Visual acuity to perform activities such as: transcribing, viewing a computer terminal, reading, visual inspection involving small parts

•Occasional lifting of up to 30 lbs; exerting up to 30 lbs of force occasionally and/or up to 10 lbs of force frequently, and/or a negligible amount of force constantly to move objects

Preferred Qualifications

* Previous experience in a pharmacy, retail, medical, or customer service setting
* Previous experience as a Pharmacy Technician
* PTCB National Certification

Education

* High School diploma or equivalent (preferred)

**Why CVS Health?**

CVS Health is the leading health solutions company that delivers care in ways no one else can. We help people navigate the health care system — and their personal health care — by improving access, lowering costs and being a trusted partner for every meaningful moment of health. And we do it all with heart, each and every day. As a CVS Health colleague, you will have a positive impact on millions of people's lives and inspire healthy behaviors in your community.

We are an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring or promotion based on race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, age, disability or protected veteran status.

Location: 70 Atlantic Avenue, Oceanside, New York 11572

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

title: Writing Tutor
description:
Alliance Tutoring seeks an experienced Writing tutor/Executive Function Coach for an **in person** tutoring contract job in Greenwich, CT. The tutor would be assisting a student at Brunswick in humanities work (English/History). A **male tutor** is much preferred.

A masters degree is required, as is 3-5 years of tutoring/teaching experience. Experience working with students with anxiety and ADHD is highly preferred. Reliability, flexibility, and rapid communication are highly valued.

**Alliance Tutoring**

AT is a company that operates online, but also conducts business locally with in-person tutoring and in-home academic coaching offerings throughout Fairfield and Westchester Counties, as well as Northern NJ. Alliance focuses on those students who are stuck: between schools, between school and college, between college and life, or simply between themselves and their futures.

It features a set of elite academic tutors with exceptional backgrounds, who utilize an intentional personal connection with the students to help loosen them up and help them get back on the track of their life goals. It offers both personal and academic support.

For more information, please visit our website at https://www.alliancetutoring.com/

Job Types: Part-time, Contract

Pay: $100.00 per hour

* Weekends as needed

title: Office Administrative Assistant
description:
Title: Practice Administration, Assistant to Owner

Purpose: To create a professional practice image by performing the duties of Front Desk Assistant and Reception.

QUALIFICATIONS

Skills

Ability to work in a low to medium volume atmosphere, in a high end practice valuing discretion, best possible customer service; ability to organize and prioritize work and to meet deadlines; implement new policies and procedures; excellent written and oral communication skills. To be interested and helpful in the development of the practice, in terms of volume, professionalism, and transition from traditional insurance based model. Strong observation, analytical and problem-solving skills.

Education:

Associates or Bachelor’s degree

Experience

**At least 1 year of experience in administrative office work and/or business management. EXPERIENCE IN HEALTHCARE FIELD IS NOT REQUIRED. In fact, we looking for an open minded professional, interested in changing the status quo.**

Strong computer skills in Microsoft Office and or Google Suite. And preferably, electronic medical record and medical billing systems, will train in WebPT and Therabill if not familiar.

Reliability

Must be attentive, able to follow instructions, demonstrate accuracy and attention to detail, and have an acceptable attendance record

Administrative and Management Functions:

Exhibit exceptional patient, staff and management relations and communications. Greeting patients. Attending to phone calls, voice mail and text message in a timely manner throughout working shift hours.

Daily and weekly functions:

Data entry into EMR: WebPT and Therabill.

Scheduling, over phone, and monitoring patients who self schedule.

Is proficient in and able to cover for any and all ad-lib and non-foreseable administrative demands within the company

Serves as first contact for all patient complaints and handles them appropriately in coordination with Management

Maintain good relationships with all other staff physical therapists.

Works with clinical staff to ensure necessary documentation is complete to maximize billing and payments

Maintain his or her hourly timesheet

Preferred Job Functions:

Creativity: propose new ideas, find more efficient ways of handling staff and responsibilities

Initiative: seek out new resources and be willing to take over responsibilities to ensure that the business continues to run at top efficiency

Service: maintain needs of patients first and find ways to help strengthen team unity

Job Type: Part-time

Expected hours: 12 – 20 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Professional development assistance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Education:

* Associate (Preferred)

title: Issuer Services: Director, Relationship Management
description:
Overview
  
At BNY, our culture empowers you to grow and succeed. As a leading global financial services company at the center of the world’s financial system we touch nearly 20% of the world’s investible assets. Every day around the globe, our 50,000+ employees bring the power of their perspective to the table to create solutions with our clients that benefit businesses, communities and people everywhere.
  
We continue to be a leader in the industry, awarded as a top home for innovators and for creating an inclusive workplace. Through our unique ideas and talents, together we help make money work for the world. This is what #LifeAtBNY is all about.
  
  

We’re seeking a future team member for the role of Director, Relationship Management to join our Issuer Services – Sales and Relationship Management team. This role is a hybrid work schedule (3 days a week in office) and can be located out of our New York City, NY OR Pittsburgh, PA office.
  
  

**In this role, you will make an impact in the following ways:**  

Independently develops the strategic plan for managing and growing existing client relationships, with a focus on revenue retention, while identifying opportunities to evolve client business
  
Has developed significant expertise on industry trends, competitor services/offerings and client’s business environment
  
Consult with significantly large sized clients on their strategic vision and how the firm can help them achieve that vision, and is the primary client advocate and ultimate escalation point for client satisfaction
  
Promotes firm services/product offerings that solve client challenges and achieve account growth, and evaluate and structure deal (pricing, contract terms, etc.) to determine the optimal terms for both the client and the firm
  
Develop, track, and report on relationship strategy/results for assigned client portfolio
  
Work closely with business development teams to ensure relationship management strategy is executed by account management and client service teams
  
Recommend areas for firm through leadership efforts based on client feedback, and may deliver leadership feedback both internally and externally to clients
  
Responsible for achievement of organic and incremental growth (revenue, asset) goals within assigned client portfolios
  
  

**To be successful in this role, we’re seeking the following:**  

Bachelor’s degree or the equivalent combination, while an advanced degree is highly preferred
  
10-15 years of relevant work experience in CLOs, Credit and Private Credit; experience selling across the Asset Management segment
  
  

At BNY, our culture speaks for itself. Here’s a few of our awards:
  
America’s Most Innovative Companies, Fortune, 2024
  
World’s Most Admired Companies, Fortune 2024
  
Human Rights Campaign Foundation, Corporate Equality Index, 100% score, 2023-2024 ·
  
**Best Places to Work for Disability Inclusion, Disability:** IN – 100% score, 2023-2024
  
“Most Just Companies”, Just Capital and CNBC, 2024
  
Dow Jones Sustainability Indices, Top performing company for Sustainability, 2024
  
Bloomberg’s Gender Equality Index (GEI), 2023
  
  

**Our Benefits and Rewards:**  

BNY offers highly competitive compensation, benefits, and wellbeing programs rooted in a strong culture of excellence and our pay-for-performance philosophy. We provide access to flexible global resources and tools for your life’s journey. Focus on your health, foster your personal resilience, and reach your financial goals as a valued member of our team, along with generous paid leaves, including paid volunteer time, that can support you and your family through moments that matter.
  
  

BNY assesses market data to ensure a competitive compensation package for our employees. The base salary for this position is expected to be between $125,000 and $240,000 per year at the commencement of employment. However, base salary if hired will be determined on an individualized basis, including as to experience and market location, and is only part of the BNY total compensation package, which, depending on the position, may also include commission earnings, discretionary bonuses, short and long-term incentive packages, and Company-sponsored benefit programs.
  
This position is at-will and the Company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, change in geographic location, Company or individual department/team performance, and market factors.
  
BNY is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer -Underrepresented racial and ethnic groups/Females/Individuals with Disabilities/Protected Veterans.
  
#LIHybrid
  
  

**Employer Description:**  

For over 230 years, the people of BNY Mellon have been at the forefront of finance, expanding the financial markets while supporting investors throughout the investment lifecycle. BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments and safeguards nearly one-fifth of the world's financial assets. BNY Mellon remains one of the safest, most trusted and admired companies. Every day our employees make their mark by helping clients better manage and service their financial assets around the world. Whether providing financial services for institutions, corporations or individual investors, clients count on the people of BNY Mellon across time zones and in 35 countries and more than 100 markets. It's the collective ambition, innovative thinking and exceptionally focused client service paired with a commitment to doing what is right that continues to set us apart. Make your mark: bnymellon.com/careers.
  
  

**EEO Statement:**  

BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans. Our ambition is to build the best global team – one that is representative and inclusive of the diverse talent, clients and communities we work with and serve – and to empower our team to do their best work. We support wellbeing and a balanced life, and offer a range of family-friendly, inclusive employment policies and employee forums.
company_description: The Bank of New York Mellon is one of the oldest financial institutions in the world, with prestigious clients including 80 percent of the Fortune 500.

description:

**In this role, you’ll make an impact in the following ways:**  

Leads a significant portion of assigned function for the firm.
  
Acts as the primary interface between specific business/functional area and leadership.
  
Oversees initiatives that are defined by business strategy and contribute to the organization's values and vision.
  
Identifies business unit requirements, creates project and process specifications, coordinates with project teams and ensures that projects are on schedule and within budget.
  
Develops and executes functional strategy to achieve key business objectives.
  
Ensures work is integrated across teams and that the work produced meets product/service standards and exceeds quality standards.

Bachelor’s degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required.

Strong communication and presentation skills (both verbally and in writing); able to articulate complex information in a clear and simple manner to a variety of audiences

title: Outreach Assistant
description:
**Wage** - $22.50 per hour


**Schedule –** Full Time, 8hr shifts, Monday – Friday


**Our staff also enjoy these benefits:**

* Health, dental, vision, prescription drug and life insurance
* 401(k) retirement plan
* Paid time off and paid holidays
* Professional development assistance
* Career advancement opportunities

MTC is proud to operate the **Edison** **Job Corps Center in Edison, NJ** where our staff provide quality services to our local youth. We value our professional and caring employees who are dedicated to improving people’s lives and we want **YOU** to join our team!


**What you will be doing:** You’ll be responsible for conducting direct recruiting activities, and interfacing with other outreach contractors in compliance with government and management directives.


**Essential functions:**

* Conduct direct recruitment activities, including public speaking, develop linkage with referral sources such as human services agencies, recreation centers, youth organizations, local high schools, one-stops, and churches, participate in center tours, and contact potential enrollees to explore enrollment.
* Prepare, schedule, and provide outreach presentations in the assigned area in support of the regional outreach efforts.
* Assist with leading tours, follow on all attendees with an email, text message or phone call.
* Conduct a tour survey and communicate with supervisor and the center to follow up.
* Prepare necessary and required reports related to the recruitment and retention efforts.
* Participate and promote student employability programs and activities.
**Education and Experience Requirements:**

* High school diploma or equivalency
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills including public speaking required.
* Social media and computer proficiency are also required.
* A valid driver license with an acceptable driving record.

**Why:** Make a positive impact in your community by doing meaningful work that results in a rewarding career.


Management & Training Corporation (MTC) is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
